articles.title: Southeast Asian Leaders Call For Immediate End To Violence In Myanmar - NPR
articles.description: Leaders of Southeast Asian nations attended the emergency summit about the situation in Myanmar, where the military has killed nearly 750 civilians since the coup in February.
articles.content:
Indonesian police guard the site of Saturday's ASEAN emergency summit in Jakarta, which drew protests over the invitation of Myanmar's military general.
Ed Wray/Getty Images

articles.author: ABC News
articles.title: ASEAN leaders demand immediate end to 'unacceptable' killings in Myanmar, following emergency summit - ABC News
articles.description: South-East Asian leaders say they have agreed on a plan with Myanmar's junta chief to end the crisis in the violence-hit nation, including halting the killing of civilian protesters and accepting humanitarian assistance.

articles.title: Singapore's Cabinet reshuffle: Chan Chun Sing, Ong Ye Kung and Lawrence Wong are firmly in the running for PM role, say observers - AsiaOne
articles.description: SINGAPORE - The Cabinet reshuffle announced on Friday (April 23) provides the clearest signal yet that fourth-generation (4G) ministers Chan Chun Sing, Ong Ye Kung and Lawrence Wong are firmly in the running for the country's top political job, say observers.…

articles.title: Iconic McDonald's outlet in Ridout Tea Garden to shut in December after 32 years in operation - AsiaOne
articles.description: SINGAPORE - A 32-year-old McDonald's outlet in Ridout Tea Garden will be closing its doors in December. A spokesman for the American fast food chain told The Straits Times on Friday (April 23) that the outlet will cease operations upon the expiry of its lease…
